requirements.text: Define core competencies required for evolutionary development
Identify skill gaps in current team capabilities
Create learning pathways for skill development
Adaptive planning methodologies
Iterative design and implementation practices
Continuous feedback integration
Rapid prototyping capabilities
Version control best practices for evolutionary development
Automated testing and quality assurance
Continuous integration and deployment
Refactoring and code evolution techniques
Stakeholder engagement and communication
Cross-functional team coordination
Customer feedback collection and integration
Documentation that evolves with the product
Metrics for evolutionary development success
Skill assessment methodologies
Progress tracking and reporting

Preserve Original Requirements: Keep the original requirement documents intact as source of truth
Track Evolution: Document how requirements evolve over time
Maintain Traceability: Link changes to impacted tasks and orgModel files
Support Reviews: Enable proper review workflow for requirement changes
Requirement Modifications (REQ-CHG-###) - Changes to existing requirements
Requirement Additions (REQ-ADD-###) - New requirements added
Requirement Removals (REQ-REM-###) - Requirements marked obsolete
Scope Changes (SCOPE-CHG-###) - Project scope adjustments
Process Changes (PROC-CHG-###) - Development process modifications
Naming Convention: YYYY-MM-DD-{TYPE}-{ID}-{short-description}.md
Structured change documentation using templates
Clear referencing system linking changes to affected documents
Create change document using change template for all requirement modifications
Review and approve changes through stakeholder review workflow
Update references in tasks and orgModel files when changes are implemented
Track implementation status in relevant task files
From Tasks to Changes: ../artifacts/Changes/ path pattern
From OrgModel to Changes: ../../projects/{project-name}/artifacts/Changes/ path pattern
System shall use systems theory, information theory, and object-oriented development as foundational principles
System must optimize for accurate, multi-perspective system description over UML compliance
System shall use Mermaid and structured text as primary documentation formats
System must describe all entities through a system lens using Open System framing with Boundaries, Inputs, Outputs, Environment, Constraints
System shall implement responsibility chain from Empowerers to Targeted System providing goals, resources, and constraints
System must implement value chain from Targeted System to Empowerers delivering deliverables, acceptance, and metrics
System shall support evolutionary development with recorded iterations, hypotheses, validations, corrections, and rollback points
System must always state perspective, assumptions, uncertainties, and validation methods
System shall provide structured sections with headings for Boundaries/Inputs/Outputs/Environment/Constraints
System must include collaboration protocols, responsibility chains, value chains, views, perspectives, assumptions, uncertainties, and validation methods in outputs
System shall prefer Mermaid diagrams over UML with justification required for UML usage and limitations documented
System must provide validation checklists that enforce accuracy over notation compliance
System shall deliver clear, actionable next steps in all outputs

requirements.source_file: how to merge new model to existing organization model.md
requirements.text: System must assess current model retained in orgModel folder using process breakdown hierarchy

requirements.source_file: how to merge new model to existing organization model.md
requirements.text: System shall maintain domain-model.md, process.md, collaboration.md, state-machine.md, main.md, vocabulary.md, and test-case-list.md for each process

requirements.source_file: how to merge new model to existing organization model.md
requirements.text: System must map collaboration.md messages to sub-process folders in orgModel for organized representation

requirements.source_file: how to merge new model to existing organization model.md
requirements.text: System shall identify new model using analysis skills and change management skills

requirements.source_file: how to merge new model to existing organization model.md
requirements.text: System must create corresponding models (domain, process, collaboration, state machine, main, vocabulary, test cases) for new requirements

requirements.source_file: how to merge new model to existing organization model.md
requirements.text: System shall plan integration by identifying minimum sub-process model matching new model by domain entities

requirements.source_file: how to merge new model to existing organization model.md
requirements.text: System must replace identified sub-process model with new model for seamless integration while minimizing disruption

requirements.source_file: how to merge new model to existing organization model.md
requirements.text: System shall generate tasks for development team based on identified changes to implement new model

requirements.source_file: how to merge new model to existing organization model.md
requirements.text: System must implement changes with stakeholder training and close monitoring to address issues promptly

requirements.source_file: how to merge new model to existing organization model.md
requirements.text: System shall evaluate and refine with stakeholder feedback and performance metrics for continuous improvement
